items.title: Hotter-than-forecast inflation leaves RBA 'primed' to hike rates
items.description: Inflation rose at the end of 2025, picking up more than forecast. The Consumer Price Index rose 3.8 per cent annually in December, up from 3.4 per cent in the year to November, adding to rate hike expectations.

items.title: Breaking: Remains found during search for missing tourist Celine Cremer
items.description: Tasmania Police say a bushwalker has located human remains near the Philosopher Falls area in Waratah on Tasmania's west coast, where tourist Celine Cremer went missing in 2023.

items.title: Tony Abbott intervenes in Liberal leadership battle
items.description: Former prime minister Tony Abbott has intervened in the Liberal leadership race, urging conservatives to unite behind either Angus Taylor or Andrew Hastie in their bid to oust Sussan Ley from the top job.

items.title: Live: Bridget McKenzie says Nationals spill announcement has 'come out of the blue'
items.description: Senior Nationals senator Bridget McKenzie says Colin Boyce's announcement to run for leader has come as a surprise. Follow live.

items.title: David Littleproud faces surprise leadership challenge
items.description: Nationals leader David Littleproud will stare down a leadership challenge from Queensland MP Colin Boyce, though colleagues say it is unlikely to succeed.

items.title: Live: 'Incredibly abnormal' temperatures 20C above average in parts of Australia
items.description: Towns in New South Wales and Queensland are sweltering today amid a record-breaking heatwave, as firefighters continue to battle multiple blazes in Victoria. Follow live.

items.title: Breaking: Residents urged to evacuate as two bushfires burn in Perth's north
items.description: An emergency warning has been issued for a bushfire burning near Landsdale, in Perth's north.

items.title: Perth's Invasion Day rally 'explosives' scare hasn't been declared terrorism. Here's why
items.description: Identifying ideological motivations behind attacks is critical to separating terrorism from other events just designed to cause fear, an extremism expert told the ABC.

items.title: Man charged with hate speech hailed 'life-long bonds' with Neo-Nazis
items.description: Brandan Koschel had posted blurred images of himself standing next to prominent Neo-Nazis on a social media account earlier this month.

items.title: 'Patience is at an end': Minnesota judge orders ICE head to face court
items.description: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

items.title: Live: Djokovic's honesty costs him as 10-time champ faces exit
items.description: Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner are among the big names in action on day 11 at the Australian Open as we fast approach the business end of the tournament. Follow the action in our live blog.

items.title: Suspect in 'largest jewellery heist in US history' was deported by ICE before trial
items.description: An Ecuadorian man accused of aiding the theft of about $147 million worth of gold, gems and luxury watches was deported by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency before he could face trial.

items.title: Doomsday Clock moves closer than ever to point of human annihilation
items.description: Atomic scientists set the Doomsday Clock to 85 seconds midnight, with threats such as nuclear weapons and conflicts pushing humanity closer than ever to the point of annihilation.

items.title: 'They're gonna die': How five people tried to stop the Challenger tragedy
items.description: Forty years ago, the Challenger space shuttle disintegrated just after lift-off. A small team of engineers tried to prevent the tragedy.

items.title: 'One-off' literary festival to take place in lieu of Adelaide Writers' Week
items.description: A community literary festival will go ahead in the wake of the cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week, but those involved say it is not a replacement for the original event.

items.title: Morrison's plan to reform Islamic teaching 'worth looking at', Liberal says
items.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Bragg says Australian Muslims need to take some responsibility for extremist incidents and that a proposal for a register of Islamic preachers is worth considering.

items.title: Quiz: How well do you know this year's Hottest 100 countdown?
items.description: The Hottest 100 is done for another year. Were you paying attention?

items.title: Tongans frustrated at 'extreme' restrictions on entering US
items.description: The United States bars Tongans from short-term visits or travel for tourism and business purposes, saying too many are overstaying their visas.

items.title: Rally organiser's claim of 'bashing' by Middle Eastern men comes unstuck
items.description: March for Australia claims one of its organisers was bashed by a group of Middle Eastern men the day before Australia Day, but police and an eyewitness account have cast doubt on its claim.

items.title: Sydney's worst hotspots for microplastic pollution revealed
items.description: Microplastic pollution on Sydney's beaches and harbour shorelines has tripled in the past three years, according to a report, much of it from sources of "preventable losses".

items.title: Guilty plea over murder of Tasmanian police officer
items.description: The man accused of fatally shooting Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith pleads guilty to murder in a Devonport court.

items.title: Sobering export report for Australian producers as world turns off wine consumption
items.description: Global demand for Australian wine is continuing to dwindle, with the latest Wine Australia export report showing an 8 per cent decrease in 2025 as consumers opt for alcohol-free trends.

items.title: Luxury $1,900-a-night resort to reopen in remote valley with no road in
items.description: Guests at one of Australia's most luxurious resorts will travel on a four-wheel drive trail down the side of the Blue Mountains, with the owners committed to reopening three years after a landslide closed the only access road.

items.title: Free agent Khawaja set to play on in BBL
items.description: In the aftermath of his international retirement, Usman Khawaja is keen to extend his Big Bash career, with his preference to strike a new deal with the Brisbane Heat.

items.title: Alex Volkanovski's glorious past meets an uncertain future at UFC 325
items.description: An end of an era looms for Alex Volkanovski as he prepares for his first title defence on home soil, but ahead of UFC 325, Australia's greatest ever MMA fighter is still the nation's gold standard.
